answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!Memory loss can be triggered by sleep disorders. In another post you mention that you snore and are always tired. I think that there is a possibility that you have a sleep problem and nothing more serious. Please consult a sleep specialist to start with. Certain types of epilepsies and seizures too cause short term memory loss along with tiredness or fatigue. Chronic infections too are known to precipitate memory loss. For this you can try yoga and meditation. Disorders of the hypothalamus, chronic fatigue syndrome andpsychiatric disorders like depression too cause similar symptoms.The enumerated the possibilities should be ruled out one by one. Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: I ran out of room, but need to mention these things.  I just did a lot of blood tests which all came out negative. These include diabetes, RA, Lupus, some hormone tests i.e. testosterone etc...  CBC was fine.  The only thing slightly elevated was my cholestorol, but Dr. said not enough to be concerned.  I have experienced hypo symptoms for 1 1/2 years....cold feet, hands, dry skin, problems with weight, mental fog etc....   but blood work does not reveal. I do wake often with headaches or have headaches come on throughout the day.  Please offer any advice......  I don't know where to turn.
title: Why cant I remember 2
